pullRequest.title: Modified searchAndReduce() to return empty agg when no docs exist
pullRequest.bodyText:
Modified AggregatorTestCase.searchAndReduce() method so that it returns an empty aggregation result when no documents have been inserted.
Also refactored several aggregation tests so they do not re-implement method AggregatorTestCase.testCase()
Fixes #55824

commit.message:
Fix searchAndReduce() returning null for no docs

If no documents exist searchAndReduce() will
return an empty aggregation result
Cleaned up testCase() methods in agg tests

nodes.bodyText: This should do all the work for returning an empty aggregation. I am not 100% sure pre-pos-Collection is needed. Feedback is very welcome.
Maybe rename these so they don't "hide" the superclass method and require the casts?
What about just calling aggregator.buildEmptyAggregation? I think this one shouldn't need the pre and post stuff. Probably.

Creating a method with specific (and not generic) arguments is a shortcut that saves us from writing
   this.<CardinalityAggregationBuilder, InternalCardinality>testCase(.....)

at every test case. This method simply passes the arguments to the generic AggregatorTestCase.testCase() method. I don't have a strong opinion about which option is best and I am happy go with any of the two methods.

commit.message: Refactored code to address reviewer's comments
